"No, I have a wicked heart." 
"I know your heart," repeated the prince. "I value your friendship and wish you to have as good an opinion of me. Don't upset yourself, and let us talk sensibly while there is still time, 
be it a day or be it but an hour Tell me all 
you know about the will, and above all where it is. You must know. We will take it at once and show it to the count. He has, no doubt, for- gotten it and will wish to destroy it. You un- derstand that my sole desire is
